She opened her own company in partnership with Mack Sennett in 1916. [16][17] [citation needed] Around that same time, Normand allegedly had a miscarriage (or stillbirth) with Goldwyn's child. It was based in Culver City and was a subsidiary of the Triangle Film Corporation. Mabel Normand has a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame for her contributions to motion pictures at 6821 Hollywood Boulevard. In 1918, as her relationship with Sennett came to an end, Normand signed a $3,500-per-week contract with Samuel Goldwyn. Before she entered films at age 16 in 1909, Normand worked as an artist's model, which included posing for postcards illustrated by Charles Dana Gibson, creator of the Gibson Girl image, as well as for Butterick's clothing pattern manufacturers in lower Manhattan.[citation needed] For a short time, she worked for Vitagraph Studios in New York City for $25 per week, but Vitagraph founder Albert E. Smith admitted she was one of several actresses about whom he made a mistake in estimating their "potential for future stardom."[11] Director William Desmond Taylor shared her interest in books, and the two formed a close relationship. Her earlier Keystone films portrayed her as a bathing beauty, but Normand quickly demonstrated a flair for comedy and became a major star of Sennett's short films.[citation needed] In 1914, she starred with Marie Dressler and Chaplin in Tillie's Punctured Romance, the first feature-length comedy. Author Robert Giroux claims that Taylor was deeply in love with Normand, who had originally approached him for help in curing her alleged cocaine dependency. However, Normand's career had already slowed, and her reputation was tarnished. She embarked on a topsy-turvy relationship with him; he later brought her across to California when he founded Keystone Studios in 1912. After an extended stay in Pottenger Sanitorium, she died from pulmonary tuberculosis on February 23, 1930 in Monrovia, California at the age of 36.[26] She was interred as Mabel Normand-Cody at Calvary Cemetery, Los Angeles. She is credited as being the first film star to receive a pie thrown in the face.[12] They blew kisses to each other as her limousine drove away. Normand was the last person known to have seen Taylor alive. Born Amabel Ethelreid Normand in New Brighton, Richmond County, New York (before it was incorporated into New York City), she grew up in a working-class family. She was named after her father's only sibling, Mabel, who had died before her birth in 1892. She had 5 siblings, although only two survived into adulthood, the rest succumbing to tuberculosis.[citation needed] Her mother, Mary "Minnie" Drury, of Providence, Rhode Island,[9] was of Irish heritage, while her father was French Canadian, with his ancestral lineage dating back to Normandy, France, and their surname originally being LeNormand or Le Normand.[10] Her father, Clodman "Claude" George Normand, was employed as a cabinetmaker and stage carpenter at Sailors' Snug Harbor home for elderly seamen.[citation needed] Her intensely beguiling lead performance, directed by D. W. Griffith in the dramatic 1911 short film Her Awakening, drew attention and she met director Mack Sennett while at Griffith's Biograph Company. The films were released with extensive publicity support from the Hollywood community, including her friend Mary Pickford. In 1926, she married actor Lew Cody, with whom she had appeared in Mickey in 1918.[25] They lived separately in nearby houses in Beverly Hills. However, Normand's health was in decline due to tuberculosis. She was exonerated in the first crime, and disregarded from the second, but her film career declined. Normand appeared with Charles Chaplin and Roscoe "Fatty" Arbuckle in many short films. Most historians agree Normand persuaded Sennett to give Chaplin another chance,[14] and she and Chaplin appeared together in a dozen subsequent films, almost always as a couple in the lead roles.

This kinder garden will have a capacity of about 200 children which additionally solves the issue of placing children in kinder gardens for another 200 families in Shtip. The kinder garden should be completely ready in September this year. Today I am visiting Municipality of Shtip and the Municipality of Kochani where I see kinder gardens, objects, social work centers in order to determine the dynamics and development of the implementation of the reforms that are being implemented in the Ministry of Labor and social policy, added Carovska. We started last September and we are expecting this kinder garden to be ready this September or October and we should immediately start placing the equipment inside, which will put the kinder garden into operation as soon as possible, said Mayor Bochvarski. At the same time, company's operations are independently monitored 24/7, and the data from the measurements are available to all the relevant institutions. Any interested person can register for a visit on USJE's website, to which end the company organizes regular Open Days. All the data have continuously shown that USJE not only meets the legally allowed limits, but its operations are far below the limits. The company has been issued an Integrated IPPC License, and according to its provisions, the company applies the latest technological practices to its operations. Cementarnica USJE operates in line with the highest environmental standards. Moreover, the company has been continuously investing in modernization and all its operations are in line with state-of-the-art technology that meets the high environmental protection standards. We would like in this occasion to encourage the readers of Vecer daily to register for a visit directly through the editor's office and together with Vecer representatives to visit us at any time whatsoever. Namely, in summer, when USJE operates with a much higher intensity, the concentration of PM particles in the city is much lower, which is an additional argument that increase or decrease of PM particles is not directly related to USJE's operations. As a transparent company, we invite all interested parties to visit the company and get further information about our operations. In response to the article published in Vecer daily newspaper on 27/11/2017 titled "Skopje is suffocating, hospitals are filling up, pollution is breaking records," aiming to provide correct and accurate information to the readers, we would like to state the following: The evaporation referred to as a 'cloud of smoke' in the article is in fact water vapor, which at lower temperatures is visible to the naked eye, often causing misperception among the public, and only in wintertime. The data from the measurements can also be found on the company website www.usje.com.mk, as well as on the official website of the Ministry of Environment and Physical Planning.

The building of the Assembly of the Republic of Macedonia is one of the most monumental structures in the Republic of Macedonia, for which in 1930 competition for design of the building was announced (architect Viktor Lukomski won the competition), and it was built in 1938 following the plan of the Czech architect Victor J. The building of the Assembly of the Republic of Macedonia is one of the most monumental structures in the Republic of Macedonia, for which in 1930 competition for design of the building was announced (architect Viktor Lukomski won the competition), and it was built in 1938 following the plan of the Czech architect Victor J. In 1994 the interior of the Cabinet of the President of the Assembly and the Hall in front of the cabinet were renewed. After the independence of the Republic of Macedonia in 1991, besides being host to the Assembly of the Republic of Macedonia, the building became a host to the Cabinet of the President of the Republic. The course objectives are: - to enable students to identify and critically analyze the basic institutes of bankruptcy and bankruptcy procedure in an independent way; - to develop skills for application of the gained knowledge into practice related to bankruptcy and bankruptcy procedure; The Diploma of this study program will enable PhD students to conduct scientific research work in the field of Civil Law sciences, as well as teaching at universities in the country and abroad, and also will be actively involved in the process of strengthening the resources of government activities in terms of the country's Euro-Atlantic integration process. By studying this course, students will be expected to gain knowledge on the most important institutions of family and inheritance law from the perspective of the procedural law; to define the most important institutions of family and inheritance procedure law; to allocate the most important institutions of domestic procedure law, to name and allocate the most important procedures in the Family Law, the Law on Contentious Procedure and the Law on Non-contentious Procedure as well as the Inheritance Law; to study the trends in the development of family and civil procedure law. At the end of the 5th semester, after the research activities under the individual plan, overall results of this phase of the paper and the research will be presented publicly by the candidate. - Develops and promotes analytical and research skills of selecting the problems in theory and practice through the use of legislative acts and judicial practice; The concept of the curriculum aims to help students acquire the ability to apply their practical knowledge of civil law, a skill that every lawyer should possess. The mentor provides assessment on these activities in the form of a report to the Scientific-Teaching Council of the Faculty. In the second year (semesters 3 and 4) the candidate continues with research activity by an approved individual plan. The course is focused on problems of the quantitative methods and techniques, such as statistical analysis, texts related to theory and testing hypotheses. Special attention will be given to practical training by attending simulated court sessions. It is expected by the student to develop the technique of proper application of legal rules (reading and interpretation of civil legal norms). Specific objectives of this program consist of enabling students to identify and critically analyze the fundamental institutions of the contested procedure, non-contentious and execution procedure as well as to develop skills of applying knowledge gained in practice in relation to the management of these procedures. Publication of research activities according to the chart relevant to the media for publication. - Assess the areas of civil law in a critical manner, the scientific and practical standpoint. Students will be able to demonstrate their knowledge and skills acquired during their studies. - Has detailed knowledge of the principles and institutes of civil law, including the origin and contents. Upon successful completion of this course, students are expected to have the ability to identify and explain the difference between legal and business capacity as well as the capacity to be a party/client and contentious capacity; to identify and explain the role of the Center for Social work in family-legal procedures; to identify and explain the basic principles of contentious procedure; to sum up the basic characteristics of the most important institutions of family and inheritance procedure law. Also, the student is expected to possess normative technique: Transactions (contracts, wills), preparation of various types of complaints (lawsuits, complaints, objections, requests), and the preparation of judicial acts (judgments, decisions) and acts of other administrative bodies (decisions, contracts) that stimulate and change the civil legal relations. The course objectives are: To enable students to analyze the regulations related to trade in the EU. The thesis (dissertation) is submitted; it is then accepted by the Scientific-Teaching Council of the Faculty and then submitted to the committee members; the procedure for the public defence of the thesis begins. - Utilizes proper terminology for complex and specific issues in the area of civil law sciences; - Is able to make decisions and work more directly and effectively in all stages of civil court procedure. The course objectives are - to enable student to independently analyze the relations that are created between the one who has caused the damage and the damaged party in the event of damage, as well as to understand the importance of the institute civil-legal liability for the caused damage; - To encourage students to consult the current normative framework on the civil-legal liability, and to critically analyze the application of the rules for compensation of the damage; - To enable students to understand the strong connection that exists between the development of the civil-legal liability for compensation of the damage and the development of the contemporary market economy; - To develop a practical approach in finding solutions for the arrangement of practical cases of obligatory relations incurred by the inflicted damage; To enable students to understand the application of the regulations for liability and compensation of the damage and to be able to solve concrete cases in the field of inflicted damage; - To enable students to make comparisons between European law and the law of R. of North Macedonia in the field of civil-legal liability for compensation of damage. Students are also expected to be able to propose amendments to the family law de lege ferenda by providing arguments that would explain their proposals; to suggest new models of functioning of state authorities in family law cases; to evaluate the quality of application of existing legal solutions in practice and in everyday life; to compare similarities and differences of individual institutes of family and inheritance law. Then, the meaning and topics of descriptive and causal inference are of a great importance, longitudinal comparative research and case study. - Has detailed knowledge of civil law, as well as material and procedural as well as basic norms in key areas of civil law. The Civil Law study program aims to provide a range of modules that will form the basis of information and advanced knowledge on Civil Law matters for the purpose of preparing students to carry out professions related to this field by providing solid, specific and systematic knowledge, about institutions and concepts of Civil Law in R. Macedonia and comparative knowledge about the region and the EU. - Creates a practice of lifelong learning and service through being involved in training of persons that work in the state institutions of crime prevention. It is expected by the student to develop the technique of proper application of legal rules of property law. Activities include literature review, definition of the hypothetical framework, definition of the working methodology and determination of the individual plan as well as the first public presentation. To enable students to analyze the regulations related to the trade in the EU and in other countries. The goal is to analyse the quality of data and incorporate all theoretical and practical performances in the function of designing and writing the thesis. - Develops a set of research rules and regulations to be used in their profession. Also, the concept of the curriculum aims to help students acquire the ability to apply their practical knowledge of property law.

SEIZED MEDICAL MATERIALS, LENSES FOR EYE GLASSES, LENSES, TURBO PUMPS, AUTOMOBILE SPARE PARTS, CLOTHES AND CIGARETTES Clothing - 68 pieces of women's clothing (dresses, blouses, skirts, pants and coats), found during control of a Bulgarian registered car, with which a couple with two children arrived for entrance in the country at the border crossing point Bogorodica. The undeclared products were found at several places in the vehicle - between the personal wardrobe in two passenger bags in the boot, in a nylon bag fitted in the spare tire area, in the first-aid kit factory cavity, under both the central seats and in the passenger compartment, They were impounded and misdemeanor proceedings will be initiated against the driver. - 49 pieces of spare parts for vans and lorries (used tachographs and speed sensors and new speed sensors), detected during control of a Macedonian car, at which two Macedonian nationals arrived at the border crossing point Bogorodic, entrance section. The undeclared goods, found in the boot under the passenger bags, were impounded and a request for misdemeanor proceedings will be filed against the driver. The undeclared products were impounded and appropriate proceedings will be taken against the passenger. - 6 pieces of Mercedes-Benz automobile spare parts (sills, front and rear wings), detected by a Customs Mobile Team, during inspection of a car with German license plates, driven by a Macedonian national at the border crossing point Tabanovce Motorwa, entrance section. The undeclared products, found behind the driver's seat and in the luggage compartment, were impounded and misdemeanor proceedings will be initiated against the driver. - 80 pieces of clothing (jeans, blouses, jackets and T-shirts) and 6 pairs of trainers, detected during control of a German registered passenger van, driven by a Macedonian national at the border crossing point Tabanovce Motorway- entrance section.

Moracinin: Politicinas have less environmental awareness than citizens MP Maja Moracinin, at the same time the new president of the political party DOM, at the #ActionIntegration conference spoke about the enduring efforts of the party, as the only green party, in the context of the connection between democracy, the rule of law, social justice, protection of human rights with green alternatives and sustainable development. Citizen activist Goce Markovski asked Moracinin whether she feels personal responsibility for the low level of environmental awareness among citizens on European and green values and also about what phase the procedure for the Law on mineral resources is in. The #ActionIntegration conference on European values, green alternatives and antinationalism was organized by CIVIL – Center for Freedom in cooperation with the Heinrich Bὅll Foundation from Germany. The law is in the interest of protecting the environment and the health of the people, said Moracinin. At the last plenary session when it was put on the agenda, some of the MPs simply left the hall and there was no quorum for there to be voting", stated Moracinin, hoping that at the next session the law will be put on the agenda and that it will receive the necessary support. Now we have an entirely different, much increased awareness among citizens... In terms of environmental awareness, I do not agree with that part of the research through focus groups, because I know exactly how it was 10 years ago, and where we are now. She pointed out as examples the forming of the Inter-party parliamentary group for the rights of LGBTI persons and the informal inter-party group for the protection of the Ohrid region in cooperation with UNESCO. Awareness in relation to environmental topics was really at a very low level. It just needs to be put for voting and for the MPs to vote. However, as it does not remove significant quantities of oxygen or obstruct vision, FM-200 is also ideal for use in occupied rooms or enclosed compartments, and is quickly cleared when ventilated. Site installation and commissioning are carried out under the strictest Fire Technics Ltd. quality assurance. It is Factory Mutual (FM) approved, Underwriters Laboratories (UL) Listed, and has been approved and specified by the US Navy. FM-200 also scores where cylinder storage space is at a premium. FM-200 installations have included the protection of a local authority’s multi-million pound computer centre and a cable television company’s switch and relay station. FM-200 is suitable for virtually all total-flooding fire suppression applications, although it is most commonly used to protect vital company assets – those upon which the company’s survival might well depend.

We’ve got an incredibly exciting driver line-up this year, both are formidable racers on-track and great characters off-track. One of the key elements of the MCL35M design is the integration of the Mercedes-AMG power unit, which has taken a considerable effort from the team in Woking, as well as our colleagues at Mercedes. Lando and Daniel will, I know, do their very best to represent the team out on track. Despite our limited scope for installation in a homologated car, the team has done a fantastic job of optimising our design work. Building a Formula 1 car is never easy. Every change to these regulations presents an opportunity, and the team in Woking has been working incredibly hard in difficult conditions to maximise those opportunities. This has been no small challenge, and I want to thank every member of our team, whether at the MTC or working remotely, for the massive effort they’ve put in. Despite relatively stable technical regulations from 2020, there are several significant aerodynamic changes to the rules that are important to get right. I’m really excited to be back working with the team ahead of my third season in Formula 1. The entire team has worked hard over the short winter, together with our colleagues from Mercedes-AMG, to produce the MCL35M and provide a strong car for our drivers to race this year. Lando is a naturally fast and intelligent racer on an exciting trajectory, while Daniel is a multiple grand prix winner with a sharp racer’s edge and exceptional talent.

Enhanced participation of local ESCs in the formulation and implementation of local employment policies In support to the social partners, the ILO seeks Concept Note Proposals from the beneficiary social partners, for modernisation of the existing and development of new services, aimed at improving their relevance, influence, and visibility. This assistance is channelled through the project Strengthening Social Dialogue, funded by the European Union and implemented by the International Labour Organization. Call for Concept Note Proposals: Grants for Modernizing of Existing and Developing New Services Offering quality services is fundamental in responding to members' needs, and retaining them, but also in broadening the organization's membership through the recruitment of new companies and members. Trade Unions are struggling to gain strength and momentum to create more prominent and representative organizations able to represent workers at national, sectoral and enterprise levels better, and there is a need for improvement of the scope and quality of their services toward the members as well as to make their work more visible to the public. This, in turn, can lead to increased representativeness of the social partners and their influence over social dialogue and policy regulation processes. To this end, the International Labour Organization assists the country in its endeavours to advance the social dialogue as an essential element of the European Social Model, which promotes competitiveness, sharing of gains and enhancing economic prosperity and social well-being. A number of progress reports by the European Commission indicate a need to further develop social dialogue among the social partners in North Macedonia. In addition, by creating space to grasp members' needs, identifying current issues and developing solutions, offering services becomes a way to support policy development and policy implementation and eventually feeds the EOs advocacy work. The overall objective of the Strengthening Social Dialogue Project is to improve social dialogue as a means to create more and better jobs. The ILO experience with Employers Organisations in CEE shows that their business model cannot be sustained long term if the revenue stream is based only on membership fees.

With the same resolution the Court suspended the execution of the actions taken based on the challenged provisions noted in the above laws. The content of the challenged provision of Article 8-a paragraph 1 line 1 of the Electoral Code, analysed in terms of the requirements and recommendations contained in these international documents, it appears that the legal provisions to prevent abuse of public resources during elections should make a clear and precise distinction between permissible and illegal disposal of budget funds. According to the Court's assessment, the contested provision of Article 8-a paragraph 1 line 1 of the Electoral Code does not establish in a clear and precise manner which disposal with budgetary resources during the election process is considered illegal and as such prohibited. From the said content of Article 165-c of the Criminal Code, which sanctions the unlawful disposal of budget funds during elections, it appears that in different paragraphs of this article the legislator has established special forms of committing this crime with a description of the specific actions of commission corresponding to the prohibitions set out in Article 8-a paragraph 1, lines 2 and 3, paragraph 2 lines 1 and 2 and paragraphs 3 and 4 of the same article of the Electoral Code. The legislator established the illegal forms of disposal in other lines of this article of the Electoral Code (Article 8-a paragraph 1 lines 2, 3 and 4) with prohibition of for instance the commencement of construction of infrastructure facilities, extraordinary payments of salaries and pensions, employment of new people in state and public institutions, and so on. As insufficiently precise and clear the challenged provision creates legal uncertainty, as a result of which the Court finds that it is not in compliance with the constitutional principle of the rule of law under Article 8 paragraph 1 line 3 of the Constitution of the Republic of Macedonia. Considering that Article 11 paragraph 1 of the Anti-Corruption Law regulates the same issue as the provision of Article 8-a paragraph 1 line 1 of the Electoral Code, in relation to this Article the Court also finds that it is not in accordance with the constitutional principle of the rule of law under Article 8 paragraph 1 line 3 of the Constitution. This interpretation of the provision of Article 8-a paragraph 1 line 1 of the Electoral Code derives also from Article 165-c of the Criminal Code in which violations of the provisions of Article 8-a are defined as crimes. Hence, the ban on the payment of subsidies which is prescribed in the challenged provision of Article 8-a paragraph 2 line 1 of the Electoral Code, according to the Court, is a limitation of the rights of citizens who are beneficiaries of subsidies and who acquire this right on the basis of fulfillment of certain conditions and in a procedure prescribed by law. Hence, the ban on the payment of subsidies which is prescribed in the challenged provision of Article 8-a paragraph 2 line 1 of the Electoral Code, according to the Court, is a limitation of the rights of citizens who are beneficiaries of subsidies and who acquire this right on the basis of fulfillment of certain conditions and in a procedure prescribed by law. From what has been noted it arises that subsidies represent economic budget transfers that primarily aim to encourage the development of certain economic activities through direct payments to the subjects performing those activities (ex. farmers). Although their purpose is primarily economic, there is no doubt that as a form of material assistance they also have a social function to protect the standard of certain categories of citizens who are their beneficiaries. Hence, the ban on the payment of subsidies which is prescribed in the challenged provision of Article 8-a paragraph 2 line 1 of the Electoral Code, according to the Court, is a limitation of the rights of citizens who are beneficiaries of subsidies and who acquire this right on the basis of fulfillment of certain conditions and in a procedure prescribed by law. This Decision shall generate legal effects from the date of its publication in the "Official Gazette of the Republic of Macedonia". By contrast, abuse of public resources should be sanctioned by law because of the unlawful use of public resources by those in power and state officials for campaign purposes." This view of the Court is corroborated and is in line with international standards pertaining to this issue. Considering that the protection of legitimate expectations of the subjects of law is an integral element of the principle of the rule of law, it appears that the disputed provision of Article 8-a paragraph 2 line 1 of the Electoral Code is not in accordance with this constitutional principle which is a fundamental value of the constitutional order of the Republic of Macedonia. During the Leaders' meeting yesterday between Prime Minister Zoran Zaev and the opposition party's leader Hristijan Mickoski, it was agreed that the census in North Macedonia will be postponed from April to September, i.e between the 5th and 30th of September this year. Contacts: Polina Hristova – Comminical officer, tel. +359882508721, e-mail: phristova@greenbalkans.org The tour of Green Balkans and friends for NATURA 2000 is realized with the cooperation of: More than 30% of the territory of Bulgaria falls within the scope of the network - 120 areas for the protection of wild birds and 234 areas for the protection of natural habitats. Furthermore, they could hear more about the biology of the bats, the migration of the Red-breasted Goose and the return of the Saker Falcon as a nesting species in our state. And about many other species that Green Balkans is working with for years. Additional information: Natura 2000 Natura 2000 is the largest coordinated network for nature conservation. All bat species are protected by the Biodiversity Act, and the forest and underground habitats of the species are protected within the Natura 2000 ecological network. Listed as an endangered species and included in the Birds Directive, the Sandwich Tern and its habitats are protected by the Natura 2000 ecological network. Also, they had the opportunity to learn more about the vultures found in Bulgaria, the Lesser Kestrel that has returned in our country and the cetaceans’ conservation activities in the Black Sea. Persecuted in the past, not much is known today about the state of the populations of the three species. Lesser Kestrel The Lesser Kestrel – once extinct as a nesting species in the country and successfully restored 25 years later, thanks to the Green Balkans activities in the Sakar Mountains. The species and its habitats are preserved in the Natura 2000 ecological network. All bat species are protected by the Biodiversity Act, and the forest and underground habitats of the species are protected within the Natura 2000 ecological network. Cetaceans There are 3 species of cetaceans in the Black Sea - Bottlenose Dolphin, Short-beaked Common Dolphin and Harbour Porpoise, endemic to our sea. Thanks to years of hard work, today the population of the species in Pomorie Lake is the largest on the Balkan Peninsula. Red-breasted Goose The Red-breasted Goose is a globally endangered species, protected within the Natura 2000 ecological network. Thanks to the efforts of conservation organizations, today the population of the species is growing and we can see it in the Balkan Mountains, Eastern Rhodopes and Kresna. The species and its habitats are protected by the Natura 2000 ecological network. In the cockpit of the Su-35 there are 3 displays for working in multi-screen mode, as well as a holographic indicator on the windshield. The aircraft is equipped with an advanced information-control system and the N035 Irbis radar with effective EPR capable of detecting targets at a distance of up to 400 km. Su-27 is the main military aircraft of the Russian Air Force. Serial Su-27s are painted in standard “sky” camouflage for fighters from three shades of blue. Foreign military media rightfully call this machine one of the most serious opponents in the airspace. The aircraft is equipped with a large number of weapons. There are two AL-41F1S engines on this plane, which are structurally distinguished by multi-plane thrust vector control. The aircraft uses improved radar “Beetle” (can be presented in two variations). The PAK FA glider is made according to the normal aerodynamic scheme and has an integral type. One of the best air defense defenses in the world is Russian. The basic configuration involves the installation of medium-range missiles designed to destroy air targets. The practical ceiling is limited to 17,500 m. The maximum speed at the ground is 1400 km / h, but when climbing to a great height, the aircraft can accelerate to 2100 km / h. It belongs to the 4 ++ generation, although its technical characteristics actually allow us to call it the advanced aircraft of the new generation.

The media offered no analysis that would show why was the organisation of the event so bad, why so few people turned up, why commercial advertisements were integrated in the campaign video, why the sound-system was so bad. Ask Questions of Political Figures and Public Personalities. use the opportunity to present their findings on the current situation in that area in Macedonia; Namely, the media didn't use the opportunity (the very raison d'etre of such events) to remind the citizens (and authorities likewise) about the statistics, cases and activities related to violence against women in Macedonia. That role implies a deeper interest in the concept of human rights, an analysis of activities of the state aimed to facilitate their practicing, reaction to major violations of human rights and promotion of activities (events) aimed to raise the awareness about a given problem (injury) related to human rights. The media play, or should play, a huge role in promotion and protection of human rights. I would place in the same context the media coverage of the latest event related to human rights, which was supposed to animate the public, but above all the state/government/politics about the violence against a specific vulnerable group – the women. The media didn't use the event to approach the politicians and ask them what they did to reduce violence against women, what they intended to do in the future to fight violence against women, whether that issue has been integrated in their election campaign platforms? A true involvement by the media implies a continuing reporting on preparations, analysis related to the idea and the goal of the movement, public calls and actual participation in the event not as observers/reporters, but as an integral part of the activity. All those are undertaken with the goal to animate as many citizens to raise their voice against violence against women. The media didn't find it necessary to explain the name of the movement and offer explanation about the "V" in V-Day. It is customary to use such events to tie them to current social or political affairs and situations in a country. Art has the power to transform thinking and inspire people to act No media got actively involved in the organization of the event, which is prepared for months. No connection was made with the global masculinization of society, manifested not only in the absence of women from key positions of power, but also in the manner how new architectural solutions present the history in such a way to emphasize the role of male sex in history and, in essence, focus on violence throughout history and neglect the other values. The role of the watchdog is given by special media, but certain elements of that function are expected to be integrated in journalism in general and in the operations of each and every media outlet. Rather bombastic headlines like "Macedonia Joins the Global Campaign to Put an End to Violence against Women" were used as a smoke-screen for a couple of poor and rashly written paragraphs, leaving the impression that they covered an event that opposes domestic or other form of violence happening in other countries and to other women, not an event that allows the women to raise their voice against the very conditions that create a violent environment and result in specific forms of violence against women in the world and in Macedonia. The country rarely takes part in global human rights-related events and the media are the entities that could contribute greatly to escape that ghetto of insufficient information. The politicians de facto said that they couldn't care less about the violence against women, and the media didn't react to that in any way or fashion. The whole process depends on a developed methodology, creation of relationships, use of video and print promotional materials, efforts to explain its aims and purpose. Lasting social and cultural change is spread by ordinary people doing extraordinary things Not in Macedonia, though. Local women best know what their communities need and can become unstoppable leaders help promote the underlying idea of the event; As if those issues were not part of the obligations of the state. No media was bothered by the absence of political figures from such an action, as if it was totally normal and OK. Organisation of the event. The media never asked why so few people joined the action in the city square and what was going on in the other cities and towns in Macedonia. The analysis is made possible by the generous support of the American people through the United States Agency for International Development (USAID). help organize the event; Tying it to other events and developments. According to the movements website, the "V" stands for Victory, Valentine and Vagina. The fine investigative journalist can and should place the protection of human rights and vulnerable groups in the context of current political affairs and position him or herself as a critic and controller of the government that has accepted the obligation to create the conditions in which all citizens can equally practice their rights and freedoms. It often seems that vulnerable groups and protection of human rights are not as attractive subject matter for the media as the current political affairs, and it seems equally often that they are not really connected with each other directly. Macedonia finds itself in a sort of a ghetto, from the viewpoint of global developments related to promotion and protection of human rights. One must look at the intersection of race, class, and gender to understand violence against women Initiated by the global V-Day movement, on February 14 we had the "One Billion Rising" event that marked, all over the world, the preparedness and the will of the people to oppose the widespread violence against women. The event also marked the 15th anniversary of the V-Day movement. By: Prof. Mirjana Najchevska, PHD, human rights expert The media didn't raise the question where were the politicians, public personalities, academics, the plethora of NGOs that allegedly work in the are of gender equality and prevention of discrimination of women? While events like this aim to attract media attention and get the front-page treatment, the media are expected to:

We encourage all employees of the Ministry of Interior, the Intelligence Agency, the National Security Agency and the Financial Police Directorate to continue their dedicated and sacrificial performance of their official duties, and the MPS shall continue to fight for improvement of the labor rights of all police officers in the country and we shall continue to ask for a reward in amount of one average salary. The leadership of the Macedonian Police Union in the period that has passed on several occasions by Minister Chulev, despite a series of requests, asked from the Minister that all employees of the Ministry of Interior as a special contribution in the fight against Covid 19, to receive a reward of at least one average salary. The Ministry did not accept our request. Today, after the statement of the Minister of Finance, it was announced that the Ministry of Interior does not have the funds, ie no funds for payment of 15,000 denars for each employee and that the supplementary budget did not require funds for this purpose. For us as the only representative union of the police, the amount of 15,000 denars is underestimating, which is why we ask the Minister to urgently find a way and funds to pay all employees in the Ministry of Interior a reward of at least 25,000 denars. The Macedonian Police Union hopes for public support for our request because all citizens of the Republic of North Macedonia are aware of the sacrifice and commitment of members of the Ministry of Interior in order to preserve the health, property of citizens and public order and peace. during the pandemia.

Antibiotic resistance presents one of the biggest threats to global health and development today – and the threat is growing. On any given day, about 80 000 patients – or 1 in 18 patients in hospitals – in the European Union have at least one health care associated infection, i.e. an infection contracted when receiving health care or during a stay at a health facility, according to estimates from the European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC). The week aims to increase awareness of global antibiotic resistance and to encourage best practices among the general public, health care workers and policy-makers to avoid its further emergence and spread. This year, WAAW focuses in particular on health workers and the vital role they play in defending the power of antibiotics. This year, the world will mark the second annual World Antibiotic Awareness Week (WAAW), with the overarching theme "Handle with Care", from 14 to 20 November. The WHO Report on the Burden of Endemic Health Care-Associated Infection Worldwide states that, in Europe, these infections cause 16 million extra days spent in hospital as well as 37 000 attributable deaths, and that they contribute to an additional 110 000 deaths every year. Now is the time for health care workers, policy-makers and the general public, alike, to take action and "handle antibiotics with care" to halt the spread of antibiotic resistance and promote the responsible use of these life-saving medicines. Steps can be taken at all levels of society to reduce the impact and limit the spread of resistance. Antibiotic resistance is accelerated by the misuse and overuse of antibiotics, as well as poor infection prevention and control. This year, the world will mark the second annual World Antibiotic Awareness Week (WAAW), with the overarching theme "Handle with Care", from 14 to 20 November. Course Goals (acquired competencies): Acquiring adequate knowledge of EU and national policies regarding energy efficiency of buildings, energy characterization of the buildings, integration of renewable energy in buildings in order to lower energy consumption, as well as tools and methods for energy modelling of buildings and management and financial viability of the techniques. • National Energy Calculation Methods and Techniques. • Energy characterization of the building (electrical and thermal performance calculations). Capable to promote energy efficiency in construction with special emphasis on near zero energy buildings (nZEB). • Materials & Installations suitable for nZEB design and retrofitting. • Description of tools and methods for Energy Building Modelling. • Real examples/ Case studies. • EU + national policies regarding energy efficiency + nZEB (EPBD + EED). • General overview between newly build and retrofit buildings. • Analysis of building stock in Macedonia and main uses. • Management and Financial Issues (Cost/Benefit balance, Return of the investment and Cost optimal for Macedonia). • Integration of Renewable Energy generation (Electrical, Heat and Storage).

CELTA is the initial international standard for quality teaching, recognised throughout the world by almost all organisations which employ English language teachers. • People starting a career in English Language Teaching You may be looking to begin a long term career in English Language teaching and see CELTA as a springboard into a good teaching post in the country of your choice. The Cambridge CELTA is the best known and most widely taken initial certificate of its kind. You can rely on its quality and recognition because it is awarded by Cambridge Assessment English, part of the University of Cambridge.

The Video Call Center project is available, interpreters in a sign language are available through a mobile application that is of a great importance for the communication of the deaf with state authorities and institutions through two interpreters in a sign language that will be available from 8 to 20 hours.

7 And not by his coming only, but also by the consolation, wherewith he was comforted in you, relating to us your desire, your mourning, your zeal for me, so that I rejoiced the more. 12 Yet the signs of my apostleship have been wrought on you, in all patience, in signs, and wonders, and mighty deeds. 12 So then death worketh in us, but life in you. 5 Now he that maketh us for this very thing, is God, who hath given us the pledge of the Spirit. 17 For we are not as many, adulterating the word of God; but with sincerity, but as from God, before God, in Christ we speak. 10 For we must all be manifested before the judgement seat of Christ, that every one may receive the proper things of the body, according as he hath done, whether it be good or evil. 8 For if also I should boast somewhat more of our power, which the Lord hath given us unto edification, and not for your destruction, I should not be ashamed. 20 For all the promises of God are in him, It is; therefore also by him, amen to God, unto our glory. Behold, now is the acceptable time; behold, now is the day of salvation. 15 And his bowels are more abundantly towards you; remembering the obedience of you all, how with fear and trembling you have received him. For we are come as far as to you in the gospel of Christ. 6 Now this I say: He who soweth sparingly, shall also reap sparingly: and he who soweth in blessings, shall also reap blessings. 7 Every one as he hath determined in his heart, not with sadness, or of necessity: for God loveth a cheerful giver. 10 And herein I give my advice; for this is profitable for you, who have begun not only to do, but also to be willing, a year ago. 24 Wherefore shew ye to them, in the sight of the churches, the evidence of your charity, and of our boasting on your behalf. This also we pray for, your perfection. 1 Therefore, seeing we have this ministration, according as we have obtained mercy, we faint not; 2 But we renounce the hidden things of dishonesty, not walking in craftiness, nor adulterating the word of God; but by manifestation of the truth commending ourselves to every man's conscience, in the sight of God. 16 And what agreement hath the temple of God with idols? 2 For I am jealous of you with the jealousy of God. 17 Now the Lord is a Spirit. 13 For I mean not that others should be eased, and you burthened, but by an equality. Wherein if any man dare (I speak foolishly), I dare also. 11 For behold this selfsame thing, that you were made sorrowful according to God, how great carefulness it worketh in you; yea defence, yea indignation, yea fear, yea desire, yea zeal, yea revenge: in all things you have shewed yourselves to be undefiled in the matter. 14 For the charity of Christ presseth us: judging this, that if one died for all, then all were dead. 9 But that I may not be thought as it were to terrify you by epistles, 10 (For his epistles indeed, say they, are weighty and strong; but his bodily presence is weak, and his speech contemptible,) 11 Let such a one think this, that such as we are in word by epistles, when absent, such also we will be indeed when present. 4 For the weapons of our warfare are not carnal, but mighty to God unto the pulling down of fortifications, destroying counsels, 5 And every height that exhalteth itself against the knowledge of God, and bringing into captivity every understanding unto the obedience of Christ; 6 And having in readiness to revenge all disobedience, when your obedience shall be fulfilled. 7 But we have this treasure in earthen vessels, that the excellency may be of the power of God, and not of us. 8 In all things we suffer tribulation, but are not distressed; we are straitened, but are not destitute; 9 We suffer persecution, but are not forsaken; we are cast down, but we perish not: 10 Always bearing about in our body the mortification of Jesus, that the life also of Jesus may be made manifest in our bodies. 13 For what is there that you have had less than the other churches, but that I myself was not burthensome to you? 3 And I know such a man (whether in the body, or out of the body, I know not: God knoweth): 4 That he was caught up into paradise, and heard secret words, which it is not granted to man to utter. 5 For we preach not ourselves, but Jesus Christ our Lord; and ourselves your servants through Jesus. 16 I rejoice that in all things I have confidence in you. 14 And no wonder: for Satan himself transformeth himself into an angel of light. God knoweth it. 15 For all things are for your sakes; that the grace abounding through many, may abound in thanksgiving unto the glory of God. 10 For the sorrow that is according to God worketh penance, steadfast unto salvation; but the sorrow of the world worketh death. 1 Behold, this is the third time I am coming to you: In the mouth of two or three witnesses shall every word stand. 14 And if I have boasted any thing to him of you, I have not been put to shame; but as we have spoken all things to you in truth, so also our boasting that was made to Titus is found a truth. 13 But we will not glory beyond our measure; but according to the measure of the rule, which God hath measured to us, a measure to reach even unto you. 4 Who comforteth us in all our tribulation; that we also may be able to comfort them who are in all distress, by the exhortation wherewith we also are exhorted by God. Did Titus overreach you? 29 Who is weak, and I am not weak? 14 Bear not the yoke with unbelievers. For what participation hath justice with injustice? 14 Now thanks be to God, who always maketh us to triumph in Christ Jesus, and manifesteth the odour of his knowledge by us in every place. And if we have known Christ according to the flesh; but now we know him so no longer. 12 You are not straitened in us, but in your own bowels you are straitened. 10 For which cause I please myself in my infirmities, in reproaches, in necessities, in persecutions, in distresses, for Christ. 6 But God, who comforteth the humble, comforted us by the coming of Titus. 1 Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, and Timothy our brother: to the church of God that is at Corinth, with all the saints that are in all Achaia: 2 Grace unto you and peace from God our Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ. 16 Wherefore henceforth, we know no man according to the flesh. 7 (For we walk by faith, and not by sight.) 7 That as in all things you abound in faith, and word, and knowledge, and all carefulness; moreover also in your charity towards us, so in this grace also you may abound. 23 But I call God to witness upon my soul, that to spare you, I came not any more to Corinth: 24 Not because we exercise dominion over your faith: but we are helpers of your joy: for in faith you stand. Chapter 2 We speak before God in Christ; but all things, my dearly beloved, for your edification. Chapter 6 1 And we helping do exhort you, that you receive not the grace of God in vain. 13 For we write no other things to you than what you have read and known. 4 And such confidence we have, through Christ, towards God. For we have said before, that you are in our hearts, to die together, and to live together. 14 In this present time let your abundance supply their want, that their abundance also may supply your want, that there may be an equality, 15 As it is written: He that had much, had nothing over; and he that had little, had no want. 4 For out of much affliction and anguish of heart, I wrote to you with many tears: not that you should be made sorrowful: but that you might know the charity I have more abundantly towards you. 4 Great is my confidence for you, great is my glorying for you. 19 And not that only, but he was also ordained by the churches companion of our travels, for this grace, which is administered by us, to the glory of the Lord, and our determined will: 20 Avoiding this, lest any man should blame us in this abundance which is administered by us. 32 At Damascus, the governor of the nation under Aretas the king, guarded the city of the Damascenes, to apprehend me. 33 And through a window in a basket was I let down by the wall, and so escaped his hands. 13 For such false apostles are deceitful workmen, transforming themselves into the apostles of Christ. 18 But all things are of God, who hath reconciled us to himself by Christ; and hath given to us the ministry of reconciliation. For you are the temple of the living God; as God saith: I will dwell in them, and walk among them; and I will be their God, and they shall be my people. 3 Yet so that we be found clothed, not naked. 4 For we also, who are in this tabernacle, do groan, being burthened; because we would not be unclothed, but clothed upon, that that which is mortal may be swallowed up by life. For the letter killeth, but the spirit quickeneth. Did we not walk with the same spirit? 3 Do you seek a proof of Christ that speaketh in me, who towards you is not weak, but is mighty in you? 10 And he that ministereth seed to the sower, will both give you bread to eat, and will multiply your seed, and increase the growth of the fruits of your justice: 11 That being enriched in all things, you may abound unto all simplicity, which worketh through us thanksgiving to God. 20 For I fear lest perhaps when I come I shall not find you such as I would, and that I shall be found by you such as you would not. 11 You helping withal in prayer for us: that for this gift obtained for us, by the means of many persons, thanks may be given by many in our behalf. 7 That our hope for you may be steadfast: knowing that as you are partakers of the sufferings, so shall you be also of the consolation. 6 To him who is such a one, this rebuke is sufficient, which is given by many: 7 So that on the contrary, you should rather forgive him and comfort him, lest perhaps such a one be swallowed up with overmuch sorrow. 15 And Christ died for all; that they also who live, may not now live to themselves, but unto him who died for them, and rose again. 19 For the Son of God, Jesus Christ who was preached among you by us, by me, and Sylvanus, and Timothy, was not, It is and It is not, but, It is, was in him. 12 But what I do, that I will do, that I may cut off the occasion from them that desire occasion, that wherein they glory, they may be found even as we. 7 Now we pray God, that you may do no evil, not that we may appear approved, but that you may do that which is good, and that we may be as reprobates. 1 Would to God you could bear with some little of my folly: but do bear with me. 17 Whereas then I was thus minded, did I use lightness? 2 You are our epistle, written in our hearts, which is known and read by all men: 3 Being manifested, that you are the epistle of Christ, ministered by us, and written not with ink, but with the Spirit of the living God; not in tables of stone, but in the fleshly tables of the heart. 14 Behold now the third time I am ready to come to you; and I will not be burthensome unto you. For I seek not the things that are yours, but you. For neither ought the children to lay up for the parents, but the parents for the children. 11 For we who live are always delivered unto death for Jesus' sake; that the life also of Jesus may be made manifest in our mortal flesh. Know you not your own selves, that Christ Jesus is in you, unless perhaps you be reprobates? 13 All the saints salute you. 11 Knowing therefore the fear of the Lord, we use persuasion to men; but to God we are manifest. 3 And I wrote this same to you; that I may not, when I come, have sorrow upon sorrow, from them of whom I ought to rejoice: having confidence in you all, that my joy is the joy of you all. 17 If then any be in Christ a new creature, the old things are passed away, behold all things are made new. 8 And God is able to make all grace abound in you; that ye always, having all sufficiency in all things, may abound to every good work, 9 As it is written: He hath dispersed abroad, he hath given to the poor: his justice remaineth for ever. 10 Who hath delivered and doth deliver us out of so great dangers: in whom we trust that he will yet also deliver us. If any man trust to himself, that he is Christ's, let him think this again with himself, that as he is Christ's, so are we also. Or do we need (as some do) epistles of commendation to you, or from you? I am filled with comfort: I exceedingly abound with joy in all our tribulation. 8 For although I made you sorrowful by my epistle, I do not repent; and if I did repent, seeing that the same epistle (although but for a time) did make you sorrowful; 9 Now I am glad: not because you were made sorrowful; but because you were made sorrowful unto penance. For you were made sorrowful according to God, that you might suffer damage by us in nothing. 10 The truth of Christ is in me, that this glorying shall not be broken off in me in the regions of Achaia. 11 Wherefore? 13 But having the same spirit of faith, as it is written: I believed, for which cause I have spoken; we also believe, for which cause we speak also: 14 Knowing that he who raised up Jesus, will raise us up also with Jesus, and place us with you. 15 And in this confidence I had a mind to come to you before, that you might have a second grace: 16 And to pass by you into Macedonia, and again from Macedonia to come to you, and by you to be brought on my way towards Judea. 2 I have told before, and foretell, as present, and now absent, to them that sinned before, and to all the rest, that if I come again, I will not spare. 3 And if our gospel be also hid, it is hid to them that are lost, 4 In whom the god of this world hath blinded the minds of unbelievers, that the light of the gospel of the glory of Christ, who is the image of God, should not shine unto them. 3 But I fear lest, as the serpent seduced Eve by his subtilty, so your minds should be corrupted, and fall from the simplicity that is in Christ. For Christ, we beseech you, be reconciled to God. 17 Wherefore, Go out from among them, and be ye separate, saith the Lord, and touch not the unclean thing: 18 And I will receive you; and I will be a Father to you; and you shall be my sons and daughters, saith the Lord Almighty. 12 We commend not ourselves again to you, but give you occasion to glory in our behalf; that you may have somewhat to answer them who glory in face, and not in heart. 22 They are Hebrews: so am I. They are Israelites: so am I. They are the seed of Abraham: so am I. 23 They are the ministers of Christ (I speak as one less wise): I am more; in many more labours, in prisons more frequently, in stripes above measure, in deaths often. 15 But I most gladly will spend and be spent myself for your souls; although loving you more, I be loved less. 21 For we forecast what may be good not only before God, but also before men. 6 For although I be rude in speech, yet not in knowledge; but in all things we have been made manifest to you. 7 Or did I commit a fault, humbling myself, that you might be exalted? 18 But we all beholding the glory of the Lord with open face, are transformed into the same image from glory to glory, as by the Spirit of the Lord. Chapter 4 12 Having therefore such hope, we use much confidence: 13 And not as Moses put a veil upon his face, that the children of Israel might not steadfastly look on the face of that which is made void. Chapter 5 1 For we know, if our earthly house of this habitation be dissolved, that we have a building of God, a house not made with hands, eternal in heaven. 6 For God, who commanded the light to shine out of darkness, hath shined in our hearts, to give the light of the knowledge of the glory of God, in the face of Christ Jesus. 30 If I must needs glory, I will glory of the things that concern my infirmity. 16 But when they shall be converted to the Lord, the veil shall be taken away. 18 But God is faithful, for our preaching which was to you, was not, It is, and It is not. 15 For we are the good odour of Christ unto God, in them that are saved, and in them that perish. 16 To the one indeed the odour of death unto death: but to the others the odour of life unto life. And for these things who is so sufficient? For I ought to have been commended by you: for I have no way come short of them that are above measure apostles, although I be nothing. 11 Now therefore perform ye it also in deed; that as your mind is forward to be willing, so it may be also to perform, out of that which you have. 12 For if the will be forward, it is accepted according to that which a man hath, not according to that which he hath not. 11 I am become foolish: you have compelled me. 8 For we would not have you ignorant,brethren, of our tribulation, which came to us in Asia, that we were pressed out of measure above our strength, so that we were weary even of life. Chapter 7 1 Having therefore these promises, dearly beloved, let us cleanse ourselves from all defilement of the flesh and of the spirit, perfecting sactification in the fear of God. 5 For also when we were come into Macedonia, our flesh had no rest, but we suffered all tribulation; combats without, fears within. 18 I desired Titus, and I sent with him a brother. 7 Now if the ministration of death, engraven with letters upon stones, was glorious; so that the children of Israel could not steadfastly behold the face of Moses, for the glory of his countenance, which is made void: 8 How shall not the ministration of the spirit be rather in glory? 20 For you suffer if a man bring you into bondage, if a man devour you, if a man take from you, if a man be lifted up, if a man strike you on the face. 5 Therefore I thought it necessary to desire the brethren that they would go to you before, and prepare this blessing before promised, to be ready, so as a blessing, not as covetousness. 9 But we had in ourselves the answer of death, that we should not trust in ourselves, but in God who raiseth the dead. 9 For you know the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ, that being rich he became poor, for your sakes; that through his poverty you might be rich. 19 For God indeed was in Christ, reconciling the world to himself, not imputing to them their sins; and he hath placed in us the word of reconciliation. 9 For if the ministration of condemnation be glory, much more the ministration of justice aboundeth in glory. 12 For our glory is this, the testimony of our conscience, that in simplicity of heart and sincerity of God, and not in carnal wisdom, but in the grace of God, we have conversed in this world: and more abundantly towards you. 5 For as the sufferings of Christ abound in us: so also by Christ doth our comfort abound. 6 Therefore having always confidence, knowing that, while we are in the body, we are absent from the Lord. 22 And we have sent with them our brother also, whom we have often proved diligent in many things; but now much more diligent, with much confidence in you, 23 Either for Titus, who is my companion and fellow labourer towards you, or our brethren, the apostles of the churches, the glory of Christ. 3 Giving no offence to any man, that our ministry be not blamed: 4 But in all things let us exhibit ourselves as the ministers of God, in much patience, in tribulation, in necessities, in distresses, 5 In stripes, in prisons, in seditions, in labours, in watchings, in fastings, 6 In chastity, in knowledge, in longsuffering, in sweetness, in the Holy Ghost, in charity unfeigned, 7 In the word of truth, in the power of God; by the armour of justice on the right hand and on the left; 8 By honour and dishonour, by evil report and good report; as deceivers, and yet true; as unknown, and yet known; 9 As dying, and behold we live; as chastised, and not killed; 10 As sorrowful, yet always rejoicing; as needy, yet enriching many; as having nothing, and possessing all things. 1 If I must glory (it is not expedient indeed): but I will come to visions and revelations of the Lord. 5 Not that we are sufficient to think any thing of ourselves, as of ourselves: but our sufficiency is from God. 24 Of the Jews five times did I receive forty stripes, save one. 25 Thrice was I beaten with rods, once I was stoned, thrice I suffered shipwreck, a night and a day I was in the depth of the sea. 26 In journeying often, in perils of waters, in perils of robbers, in perils from my own nation, in perils from the Gentiles, in perils in the city, in perils in the wilderness, in perils in the sea, in perils from false brethren. did we not in the same steps? 6 Now whether we be in tribulation, it is for your exhortation and salvation: or whether we be comforted, it is for your consolation: or whether we be exhorted, it is for your exhortation and salvation, which worketh the enduring of the same sufferings which we also suffer. 2 For he saith: In an accepted time have I heard thee; and in the day of salvation have I helped thee. Who is scandalized, and I am not on fire? 13 For whether we be transported in mind, it is to God; or whether we be sober, it is for you. And I hope that you shall know unto the end: 14 As also you have known us in part, that we are your glory, as you also are ours, in the day of our Lord Jesus Christ. 8 I speak not as commanding; but by the carefulness of others, approving also the good disposition of your charity. 13 But having the same recompense, (I speak as to my children,) be you also enlarged. 4 For although he was crucified through weakness, yet he liveth by the power of God. 11 For if that which is done away was glorious, much more that which remaineth is in glory. 1 Now I Paul myself beseech you, by the mildness and modesty of Christ, who in presence indeed am lowly among you, but being absent, am bold toward you. For, until this present day, the selfsame veil, in the reading of the old testament, remaineth not taken away (because in Christ it is made void). 16 And thanks be to God, who hath given the same carefulness for you in the heart of Titus. 17 Did I overreach you by any of them whom I sent to you? 11 Our mouth is open to you, O ye Corinthians, our heart is enlarged. 5 For such an one I will glory; but for myself I will glory nothing, but in my infirmities. And where the Spirit of the Lord is, there is liberty. 8 For we can do nothing against the truth; but for the truth. 15 Therefore it is no great thing if his ministers be transformed as the ministers of justice, whose end shall be according to their works. 9 For we rejoice that we are weak, and you are strong. 21 Him, who knew no sin, he hath made sin for us, that we might be made the justice of God in him. 8 Wherefore, I beseech you, that you would confirm your charity towards him. 9 For to this end also did I write, that I may know the experiment of you, whether you be obedient in all things. 10 And to whom you have pardoned any thing, I also. 16 But be it so: I did not burthen you: but being crafty, I caught you by guile. 16 For which cause we faint not; but though our outward man is corrupted, yet the inward man is renewed day by day. 3 For according to their power (I bear them witness), and beyond their power, they were willing. 2 For I know your forward mind: for which I boast of you to the Macedonians. That Achaia also is ready from the year past, and your emulation hath provoked very many. 3 Now I have sent the brethren, that the thing which we boast of concerning you, be not made void in this behalf, that (as I have said) you may be ready: 4 Lest, when the Macedonians shall come with me, and find you unprepared, we (not to say ye) should be ashamed in this matter. 11 For the rest, brethren, rejoice, be perfect, take exhortation, be of one mind, have peace; and the God of peace and of love shall be with you. And I trust also that in your consciences we are manifest. But in our consolation, we did the more abundantly rejoice for the joy of Titus, because his spirit was refreshed by you all. 2 I know a man in Christ above fourteen years ago (whether in the body, I know not, or out of the body, I know not; God knoweth), such a one caught up to the third heaven. 4 For if he that cometh preacheth another Christ, whom we have not preached; or if you receive another Spirit, whom you have not received; or another gospel which you have not received; you might well bear with him. 31 The God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who is blessed for ever, knoweth that I lie not. 6 Who also hath made us fit ministers of the new testament, not in the letter, but in the spirit. 17 That which I speak, I speak not according to God, but as it were in foolishness, in this matter of glorying. 12 And when I was come to Troas for the gospel of Christ, and a door was opened unto me in the Lord, 13 I had no rest in my spirit, because I found not Titus my brother; but bidding them farewell, I went into Macedonia. 18 For not he who commendeth himself, is approved, but he, whom God commendeth. Chapter 11 16 I say again, (let no man think me to be foolish, otherwise take me as one foolish, that I also may glory a little.) 14 And in their praying for you, being desirous of you, because of the excellent grace of God in you. 12 Because the administration of this office doth not only supply the want of the saints, but aboundeth also by many thanksgivings in the Lord, 13 By the proof of this ministry, glorifying God for the obedience of your confession unto the gospel of Christ, and for the simplicity of your communicating unto them, and unto all. 8 I have taken from other churches, receiving wages of them for your ministry. 9 And, when I was present with you, and wanted, I was chargeable to no man: for that which was wanting to me, the brethren supplied who came from Macedonia; and in all things I have kept myself from being burthensome to you, and so I will keep myself.

Acer Chromebook 317: Industry’s First 17.3-inch Chromebook for Multi-Tasking Masters The large FHD 17.3-inch display features an anti-glare coating and is surrounded by narrow bezels, bringing the vibrant visuals front and center. Students as well as home and business users can count on the notebook lasting all day: The device’s quick-charging battery delivers up to 10 hours of battery life[1]. The Chromebook also comes with a bevy of functional features including dual full-function USB Type-C ports with Thunderbolt™ 4, a backlit-keyboard and an optional embedded fingerprint reader. Acer's 7,500 employees are dedicated to the research, design, marketing, sale, and support of products and solutions that break barriers between people and technology. The Chromebook also includes Intel Wi-Fi 6 (Gig+). Acer Chromebook 317: Industry’s First 17.3-inch Chromebook for Multi-Tasking Masters These visuals are complemented by DTS® Audio and a built-in smart amplifier for higher-quality, distortion-free sound. “Through our deep co-engineering efforts with Acer, the new Acer Chromebook Spin 713 signifies an important step in our Intel Evo platform journey. As the first Intel Evo platform-verified Chromebook, featuring Thunderbolt 4, and delivering new levels of performance, responsiveness and battery life – we’re opening up new possibilities for better gaming, creating and entertaining experiences that our customers will love,” said Josh Newman, Intel Vice President and General Manager of Mobile Innovation, Client Computing Group. Acer Chromebook devices free IT from mundane administrative tasks, facilitate collaboration, and secure access to data and apps for the cloud workforce. Students as well as home and business users can count on the notebook lasting all day: The device’s quick-charging battery delivers up to 10 hours of battery life[1]. The soldiers "are completing their deployment at their positions in the Tkvarcheli district of Abkhazia," Russia's three main news agencies quoted the Russian Defense Ministry press office as saying. In the light of rising tensions between Georgia and its two regions over the past week, Russia decided on Tuesday to send more peacekeeping troops into the breakaway provinces. NATO announced at a summit early this month that Georgia would one day become a member of the 26-nation military alliance, in the face of fierce Russian opposition. In a statement on April 21, UNOMIG said that its monitors "did not observe anything to substantiate reports of a build-up of forces on either side." NATO and Georgian officials have confirmed that alliance ambassadors, in the so-called North Atlantic Council, will travel to Georgia in "coming months" in a show of support for the would-be candidate. In a televised address to the people of Abkhazia and South Ossetia, Saakashvili said: "Georgia wants peace." Russia has peacekeepers in Abkhazia and South Ossetia under an agreement with Georgia from the 1990s following wars in which separatists broke away and established close ties with Moscow. In a televised address to the people of Abkhazia and South Ossetia, Saakashvili said: "Georgia wants peace." The remarks came after Russia's defense ministry announced Tuesday an increase in peacekeeping forces to Abkhazia and South Ossetia in response to what it called aggressive moves by pro-Western Georgia. Finland, current chair of the 56-nation Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe [OCSE] expressed concern Wednesday over "increased tension" in Georgia. The remarks came after Russia's defense ministry announced Tuesday an increase in peacekeeping forces to Abkhazia and South Ossetia in response to what it called aggressive moves by pro-Western Georgia. Any attempt by the Georgian side to resolve the conflicts with force against Russian peacekeepers and also against Russian citizens... will be met with an adequate and tough answer, news agencies quoted the ministry as saying. No plans revealed for Georgia action Georgia has not revealed any plans to retaliate Finnish Foreign Minister Alexander Stubb issued a statement repeating previous concern over Moscow's decision to establish ties with two breakaway regions in Georgia. Finland, current chair of the 56-nation Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe [OCSE] expressed concern Wednesday over "increased tension" in Georgia. NATO announced at a summit early this month that Georgia would one day become a member of the 26-nation military alliance, in the face of fierce Russian opposition. Georgia attempts to defuse situation President Saakashvili called for an end to the conflict Georgia appeared to be attempting to prevent the dispute with Russia from further escalating with President Mikhail Saakashvili saying that the country sought an end to the conflict. Russia objects to NATO moving closer to its borders and is deeply concerned that the breakaway regions could be destabilized by Tbilisi's rapprochement with Moscow's old Cold War-era foe. Georgia claims that Russia has, over the last three months, strengthened its control over Abkhazia and established direct ties with the local authorities. What does the outcome of the elections mean for Hong Kong's future? Opinion Opinion: The ball is now in Hong Kong government's court And what is even clearer is that the vast majority of the Hong Kong people are enormously dissatisfied with Carrie Lam and her work. However, nobody actually believes that this is going to happen and that Carrie Lam, for instance, is going to fulfill the most important demand of the demonstrators an independent investigation into the excessive use of force by the police. Hong Kongers sent a clear message to the city's government in the local elections held this weekend.

This event will allow introduction of the potential investors with national and regional policies and measures to support investment and introduction with the specificities of the industrial zones. Attendees will have the opportunity to present themselves and to establish contacts for future cooperation and investment. The Centre for development of the South-East planning region together with the Region of Central Macedonia on March 5th 2014 is organizing a Closing conference for the project "Industrial zones and commercial roads in the cross border area" – Zones and Roads. The contract for the implementation of the project was signed on December 6th 2012 and it ends on March 6th 2014. Closing conference of the project ZONES AND ROADS The project is implemented under the Second call of IPA CBC Programme R. Macedonia - Greece. Also promotional materials were prepared according to the visibility rules in order to increase the visibility of the project and promote the objectives, activities and results of the project. Some of the guests at the event will be the Head of the Delegation of the European Union and European Union ambassador in Macedonia, Mr. Aivo Orav, Mayors and municipal representatives from the South-East region, representatives of potential companies from Macedonia and Greece, interested in investing in the South-East region and other guests. It will also allow awareness rising of Municipalities for joint / regional presentation of industrial zones in the region in front of the domestic and foreign investors. During the 15 months of the implementation, the project was promoted on several television stations and advertised in daily national newspaper.
